item.title: Comment on “Analyzing my text messages with my ex-boyfriend” by MPianta
item.description:
If I’m understanding this correctly they sent over 80,000 messages between them in less than a year? That’s approximately an average of one text (one direction or another) every six minutes or so. But presumably they slept some and they weren’t texting while sleeping, right? And presumably they were occasionally in class or at a movie or some other situation where they couldn’t text… or did they just text all through all of that? And presumably since they were dating they were also actually in the same place in person at some points. They didn’t text each other while in the room together did they? All this means the real text frequency is much higher than one ever six minutes… and this is only with one person! I find this vaguely horrifying for some reason. By comparison I have had only 12 texts (both outgoing and incoming) across all contacts total today. Most of those are with my wife (8).

Comment URL: https://marginalrevolution.com/marginalrevolution/2024/06/analyzing-my-text-messages-with-my-ex-boyfriend.html?commentID=160770099

Post URL: https://marginalrevolution.com/marginalrevolution/2024/06/analyzing-my-text-messages-with-my-ex-boyfriend.html?utm_source=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=analyzing-my-text-messages-with-my-ex-boyfriend

item.title: Comment on Are we overestimating the foreign-born population by about 2 million? by Steve Sailer
item.description:
It's almost as if we don't really know how many people are within the borders.
